intro: Psephellus, commonly known as the rock lily, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Iridaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa, where they typically grow in rocky or arid environments. Psephellus species are characterized by their showy, often purple or pink flowers that bloom in spring. They have linear, grass-like leaves and are adapted to survive in dry conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
